intro: Canthium hispidonervosum, commonly known as the hairy-veined canthium, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves with prominent veins. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forests or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
